meanings.sent1: Bullies often victimize others by picking on them.
meanings.sent2: It is not right to victimize someone just because they are different.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to victimize the poor little mouse during playtime.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to victimize the small town with its relentless winds and rain.
meanings.sent5: The villain's plan was to victimize the innocent townspeople for his own gain.

meanings.sent1: Some employers may victimize their employees by not paying them fairly.
meanings.sent2: It is important to stand up against those who try to victimize others through unfair treatment.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to victimize the other pets by stealing their toys.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter weather seemed to victimize the fragile flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The greedy landlord would victimize his tenants by raising the rent every month.

meanings.definition: Inflict harm or suffering on someone
meanings.sent1: Hurricanes can victimize coastal communities by causing widespread destruction.
meanings.sent2: It is heartbreaking to see anyone victimize an innocent animal.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten would victimize the houseplants by knocking them over.
meanings.sent4: The disease seemed to victimize the elderly population more than others.
meanings.sent5: The evil sorcerer would victimize the kingdom with his dark magic spells.
